thread.title: Spiders Eat More Flesh Than Humans Per Year
thread.title_full: Spiders Eat More Flesh Than Humans Per Year

author: Barry K
title: Spiders Eat More Flesh Than Humans Per Year
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
The study was also kind enough to point out the fact that Earth plays host to 25 million tons of spiders, while humans take up 315 million tons of weight. These terrifying results come from a compilation of 65 studies combined with the efforts of researchers in Germany, Switzerland and Sweden that looked into a variety of factors that ended producing staggering numbers. 
Maybe you will find comfort in the fact that the "flesh" spiders eat is almost entirely insects and that the majority of spiders live in jungles and forests, not in your apartment. Maybe you're a little amazed by the fact that that massive rib-eye steak you had last weekend is practically the equivalent of sad, residual sandwich crumbs to a spider. The fact remains that spiders love flesh, we happen to have a lot of flesh and there are 25 million tons of spiders that we have to spend every single moment of existence with. 
Even through all of the sheer horror, there is a silver lining. Spiders are working hard to eat very annoying insects every day, like mosquitoes, cockroaches and moths. But just in case that officially ruined any chance of you getting a good night's sleep this week, here's a list of foods that can help you catch some z's .
